intro: Pimpinella verrucosa var. simensis, commonly known as the Ethiopian cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It is a member of theApiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and covered in a distinctive waxy coating, while the flowers are small and white or pale yellow. This variety is notable for its ecological importance in its native habitat and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
